Package com.pandora.general.logic

Interface ShearStressLogic

All Known Implementing Classes:
ShearStressLogicImpl
public interface ShearStressLogic
The ShearStressLogic interface defines methods for calculating shear stress, critical shear stress for sediment transport, and the Shields parameter based on specified parameters. Implementing classes are expected to provide concrete implementations for these calculations.
Version:
0.0.1
Author:
Wim Joost van Hoek

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    double
    calculateCriticalShearStress(double rhoP, double g, double r, double theta, double thetaC)
    Calculates the critical shear stress for sediment transport.
    double
    calculateShearStress(double mu, double kappa)
    Calculates the shear stress based on the given parameters.
    double
    calculateShieldsParameter(double tau, double rhoP, double g, double r)
    Calculates the Shields parameter, a dimensionless parameter used in sediment transport analysis.

  • Method Details

    • calculateShearStress

      double calculateShearStress(double mu, double kappa)
      Calculates the shear stress based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      mu - the dynamic viscosity of the fluid.
      kappa - the von Kármán constant.
      Returns:
      the calculated shear stress.

    • calculateCriticalShearStress

      double calculateCriticalShearStress(double rhoP, double g, double r, double theta, double thetaC)
      Calculates the critical shear stress for sediment transport.
      Parameters:
      rhoP - the density of the sediment particles.
      g - the acceleration due to gravity.
      r - the particle radius.
      theta - the angle of repose of the sediment.
      thetaC - the critical angle of repose.
      Returns:
      the calculated critical shear stress.

    • calculateShieldsParameter

      double calculateShieldsParameter(double tau, double rhoP, double g, double r)
      Calculates the Shields parameter, a dimensionless parameter used in sediment transport analysis.
      Parameters:
      tau - the shear stress.
      rhoP - the density of the sediment particles.
      g - the acceleration due to gravity.
      r - the particle radius.
      Returns:
      the calculated Shields parameter.
